unnormalised: The Income Tax Dept. has announced an extension for filing ITR for FY 2023-24 till 31/07/2024. Seems like a bit of a reprieve for folks like me who always leave it till the last minute! Remember to declare all your income sources, including capital gains from shares (e.g., ₹10,000 profit on Tata Motors). Don't forget to claim deductions under Sec 80C – that LIC premium of Rs. 1.5 lakh can really help lower your tax liability.
normalised: The Income Tax Department has announced an extension for filing I-T-R for financial year two thousand twenty three to two thousand twenty four till thirty first july two thousand twenty four. Seems like a bit of a reprieve for folks like me who always leave it till the last minute! Remember to declare all your income sources, including capital gains from shares (e.g., rupee ten thousand profit on Tata Motors). Don't forget to claim deductions under Section eighty C – that L-I-C premium of rupees one point five lakh can really help lower your tax liability.

unnormalised: Speaking of compliance, the penalty for late filing can be steep, starting from Rs. 1000 and going up to Rs. 5000, depending on your income bracket. Also, make sure you’ve linked your Aadhaar to your PAN – very important! You can do it online via the IT portal. The last date for linking was supposedly 30/06/2023, but there might be some leeway. Check the official website for updates.

unnormalised: So, prepone all your chai breaks, grab your Form 16, and get cracking! Filing your taxes on time not only keeps you out of trouble with the Govt. but also helps build a good financial reputation. And who knows, maybe you’ll even get a refund! Good luck with your ITR filing, everyone.
